title: Your Complete Guide to the Red Tiger’s Eye Crystal

steps.title: Strength and courage
steps.content: Strength and courage The red tiger’s eye encourages boldness. It symbolizes mental, physical, and emotional strength and helps you find the courage to face your fears and stand up for yourself. This crystal can help you become the best version of yourself. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Protection
steps.content: Protection The red tiger’s eye is a very powerful protective crystal. It deflects unwanted and negative energies and has historically been used as a talisman against curses. It represents both spiritual and physical protection. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Excitement and desire
steps.content: Excitement and desire Because of its red color, this tiger’s eye sometimes symbolizes sexuality. It represents the excitement and lust that accompany romantic relationships, and some believe it even boosts sex drive. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Duality
steps.content: Duality The red tiger’s eye combines the energy of the earth with the vibrational frequencies of the sun, which gives the stone a dualistic quality. This allows you to put things into perspective and understand situations from multiple points of view. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Luck and fortune
steps.content: Luck and fortune Just as the red tiger’s eye deflects bad luck and ill intentions, it promotes good luck. Wearing or carrying a red tiger’s eye brings prosperity and positivity. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Red tiger’s eye can help you rediscover yourself.
steps.content: Red tiger’s eye can help you rediscover yourself. Many believe this stone channels the boldness of the tiger to help you build confidence and even alleviate depression. In turn, it may help you solve internal conflicts and get in touch with your inner self. Carrying or wearing red tiger’s eye is believed to help you put things into perspective so you can find out who you truly are. [6] X Research source Similarly, many believe possessing a red tiger’s eye will help you heal from emotional wounds due to its protective properties. They say it dispels anxiety and encourages you to stop dwelling on the past and move on to a better future. [7] X Research source Some claim that red tiger’s eye promotes self-care by encouraging you to put yourself first and removing and protecting you from the negative energy of day-to-day life. [8] X Research source While many believers report that red tiger’s eye has metaphysical and emotional healing benefits, these claims are not backed by science. Never rely on crystals in place of official medical care.

steps.title: Red tiger's eye can give you a boost of energy.
steps.content: Red tiger's eye can give you a boost of energy. Many believe this to be a particularly stimulating gemstone due to its connection with the sun’s vibrations. It may provide motivation and help you overcome fatigue and lethargy, so keep it on your person whenever you need a boost of energy. [9] X Research source Some say this stone balances yin and yang as well as your personal energy. Because tiger’s eye possesses the energy of the earth, it may use those energies to help you stay grounded and prevent you from dedicating too much time to something that doesn’t benefit you.

steps.title: Red tiger's eye could boost creativity.
steps.content: Red tiger's eye could boost creativity. This stone is associated with passion and that often translates to creative passions, as well. By boosting these feelings, this stone may help open up mental and emotional blockages so you can focus on your art, writing, or other creative hobbies. [10] X Research source Similarly, many claim red tiger’s eye can clear your mind and help you understand situations and solve problems objectively. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Red tiger’s eye may promote psychic ability.
steps.content: Red tiger’s eye may promote psychic ability. It raises your spiritual vibration and helps you stay grounded during spiritual activities like meditation. Meditating while holding a red tiger’s eye may help you open your third eye and tap into deeper levels of your subconscious, as the stone helps clear your mind. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Red tiger's eye may boost bone and muscle strength.
steps.content: Red tiger's eye may boost bone and muscle strength. Just as red tiger’s eye symbolizes emotional strength, it might improve physical strength, as well. Some suggest red tiger’s eye promotes healthy body tissue, which in turn encourages strength in the bones and muscles. It is even said to help heal broken bones, so wear one when you want to try to speed up recovery. [13] X Research source Some people also suggest red tiger’s eye can help your body fall into healthy, natural rhythms and improve digestion.

steps.title: Red tiger's eye could improve night vision and eye infections.
steps.content: Red tiger's eye could improve night vision and eye infections. Because of its name, many people believe the red tiger’s eye can improve eye health. Tigers have excellent night vision, so possessing a red tiger’s eye might help you see better in the dark. It may also speed up the recovery time of various eye infections and conditions if you place one over your eye. [14] X Research source

steps.title: It is believed to treat anemia.
steps.content: It is believed to treat anemia. Because red is also the color of blood, some suggest owning this crystal can treat or improve blood conditions. It may soothe conditions like high blood pressure and relieve the effects of menstruation and menopause. Some say laying the crystal on your body (in this case, the heart) can be more effective. [15] X Research source While many people believe crystals like red tiger’s eye have physical healing properties, these claims are not backed by science. Always seek professional medical assistance if you’re sick or have health conditions.

steps.title: Hold it in your hands while meditating.
steps.content: Hold it in your hands while meditating. Red tiger’s eye is said to help you clear your mind and ground yourself, so it can be especially useful when meditating . Hold a tumbled stone in your hand to soothe and relax your mind so you can get in touch with your spirituality. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Place it on your root chakra to clear blockages.
steps.content: Place it on your root chakra to clear blockages. Red tiger’s eye is associated with the root chakra located at the base of the spine. The root chakra is responsible for your sense of stability and allows you to feel firmly rooted in your life. Placing the crystal on this chakra is said to help clear blockages between the chakras and allow you to feel more connected to your true self. [17] X Research source Many claim red tiger’s eye also positively impacts your solar plexus and sacral chakras, leading to a boost in confidence. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Keep it on your person for protection.
steps.content: Keep it on your person for protection. Red tiger’s eye promotes both physical and spiritual protection. It is believed that if you carry it with you at all times, you’re less likely to come into physical harm and you’ll be protected from evil spirits and negativity. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Keep it on or near your bed to increase libido.
steps.content: Keep it on or near your bed to increase libido. Because the color red is often associated with sexuality and desire, many suggest placing a red tiger’s eye under your pillow or mattress (or on your nightstand) to spice things up in the bedroom and keep your partner satisfied. [20] X Research source Red tiger’s eye is also said to promote fertility and pregnancy.

steps.title: Place it on your workstation to boost productivity.
steps.content: Place it on your workstation to boost productivity. If you struggle to stay focused at work or have been experiencing a creativity block, a red tiger’s eye might be able to help. Keep a stone on your desk, in your office, or wherever you practice your creativity to boost your concentration.

steps.title: Keep it in your wallet to encourage a steady income.
steps.content: Keep it in your wallet to encourage a steady income. Historically, red tiger’s eye has been associated with wealth and fortune. If you need some extra cash or are hoping to get a raise at work, put a red tiger’s eye in your purse or wallet and keep it there until the money starts flowing in. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Red tiger’s eye is connected to the root chakra.
steps.content: Red tiger’s eye is connected to the root chakra. The root chakra (or base chakra), located at the base of the spine, helps ground you and provides a sense of stability and connection with your body. The red tiger’s eye opens, engages, and balances this chakra so you feel secure in your ability to meet your basic needs. When the root chakra is balanced, you’ll likely have more energy, more enthusiasm for life, and be able to sleep more peacefully. [22] X Research source

steps.title: It is sometimes associated with the sacral chakra.
steps.content: It is sometimes associated with the sacral chakra. The sacral chakra is located in the lower abdomen, just below the navel, and is frequently associated with sexual energy and creativity. Some chakra healers associate the red tiger’s eye with this chakra because the stone is believed to improve sexual relationships and increase self-love. Using the red tiger’s eye on the sacral chakra could help bring passion back to a relationship or overcome a low sex drive. [23] X Research source Red tiger’s eye may also help with the solar plexus chakra by increasing confidence.

steps.title: Red tiger’s eye is associated with the Leo zodiac sign.
steps.content: Red tiger’s eye is associated with the Leo zodiac sign. Red tiger’s eye is frequently associated with passion and energy, so it’s a perfect match for the fiery Leo. This gemstone can help rekindle the creative or energetic flame within Leos, improving focus and motivation. While red tiger’s eye may be most closely associated with Leo, it also has connections with the following zodiac signs: [24] X Research source Capricorn: Red tiger’s eye is the birthstone for Capricorns. The stone is said to help Capricorns see all sides of a situation and make wise judgments. Scorpio: Many claim that red tiger’s eye is valuable to Scorpios because it shields them from negativity and prevents pessimistic thoughts. Gemini: Some say the red tiger’s eye fits Gemini’s inquisitive, caring, and flexible temperament well.

steps.title: Hold the stone under running water.
steps.content: Hold the stone under running water. Hold your red tiger’s eye under running water for about a minute to both cleanse and charge it. For best results, use a natural spring, but if that’s not possible, tap water works fine; just make sure the crystal can be submerged completely. Alternatively, place the stone in a fountain to allow the water to run over it. When you’re done cleansing, remove it from the water and dry it with a soft cloth. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Cleanse the stone with smoke.
steps.content: Cleanse the stone with smoke. Smoke-cleansing (or smudging) is said to immediately remove negative energies. If you’re working indoors, open a window so all the negativity can leave your space. Light some sage or other bundled herbs, then blow out the flame to produce smoke. Wave your red tiger’s eye through the smoke for 30-60 seconds to cleanse it. Use a fire-safe bowl or plate and blow out the open flame immediately to be safe. Note that smudging with white sage is a closed practice, as it is a sacred tradition for many Native American cultures. Using white sage if you aren’t Native is often considered cultural appropriation, so it’s best to choose another type of sage to do your cleansing.

steps.title: Place your red tiger’s eye in a bowl of salt.
steps.content: Place your red tiger’s eye in a bowl of salt. In many spiritual practices, salt is believed to remove negative energies. Fill a bowl or jar with salt and place your crystal on top of the salt. Cover the container with a cloth and let your stone sit for a day or two. When you’re done cleansing, remove the red tiger’s eye and dispose of the salt. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Lay your crystal in sunlight.
steps.content: Lay your crystal in sunlight. The sun’s energy is a great way to charge and cleanse your crystals, but the light can discolor them, so it’s important not to leave them out for long. Set your red tiger’s eye outside or on a windowsill under direct sunlight. Generally, it should be cleansed and charged within a few minutes, but just make sure you don’t leave it out for more than an hour. [27] X Research source

steps.title: Cleanse your crystal under the full moon.
steps.content: Cleanse your crystal under the full moon. If you don’t want to expose your red tiger’s eye to the sun, the full moon is also believed to remove negativity. At twilight on the night of the full moon, place your crystal on a windowsill or anywhere it can absorb the moon’s light and energy. Let it sit overnight, then remove it before the sun gets too high the following morning. [28] X Research source

steps.title: Red tiger’s eye is a member of the quartz family.
steps.content: Red tiger’s eye is a member of the quartz family. Composed of silicon dioxide, it gets its red and black stripes from the oxidation of iron within the crystal. Red tiger’s eye is typically more of a brick red color than the gold of regular tiger’s eye, and it scores a 7 on the Mohs hardness scale. It is most commonly found in South Africa, Namibia, and Brazil, though it can also be found in the United States, Canada, and India. [29] X Research source

steps.title: Several crystals help enhance red tiger’s eye’s benefits.
steps.content: Several crystals help enhance red tiger’s eye’s benefits. When you wear or carry red tiger’s eye with other crystals, the red tiger’s eye may become more balanced and/or you’ll get the benefits of each stone. Red tiger’s eye pairs well with many different crystals, so try combining it with one of the following for their associated benefits: Black obsidian : balances the root chakra, protects from negativity, banishes fears and phobias, brings positive change to your life [30] X Research source Smoky quartz: protects from negative energy, helps with grounding, clears your mind, helps with love [31] X Research source Jasper: has strong restorative properties, helps you complete tasks, helps with grounding, banishes negativity [32] X Research source Blue tiger’s eye (Hawk’s eye/falcon’s eye): improves communication skills, increases self-understanding, helps clear your vision, brings change in your life [33] X Research source Black tourmaline : helps with grounding and balance, increases creativity and passion, cleanses energy [34] X Research source Amethyst: opens your third eye, helps with relaxation, enhances mental clarity, reduces anxiety [35] X Research source

steps.title: In ancient Egypt, red tiger’s eye represented the god Ra.
steps.content: In ancient Egypt, red tiger’s eye represented the god Ra. The ancient Egyptians believed the red tiger’s eye was created when the sun god Ra’s third eye fell to earth and became a gemstone. The Egyptians, especially pharaohs, wore the stone as jewelry to channel Ra’s energy and achieve material success, strength, and creativity. [36] X Research source In other parts of Africa, the red tiger’s eye is believed to protect the wearer from all kinds of spiritual harm, including curses, negative influences, bad ideas, and general evil-doing.

steps.title: In India, red tiger’s eye symbolizes the Hindu goddess Durga.
steps.content: In India, red tiger’s eye symbolizes the Hindu goddess Durga. Durga represents strength, protection, and courage, and her connection with the red tiger’s eye likely stems from the fact that she’s often depicted riding a tiger named Dawon. Worshippers wear or carry the red tiger’s eye to gain Durga’s protection and inspiration, as well as to receive luck and strength to overcome obstacles. [37] X Research source Similarly, red tiger’s eye was believed to bring good fortune in ancient China. In Eastern mythology, the tiger symbolized courage, integrity, and the correct use of power.

steps.title: Ancient Roman soldiers wore the stone to battle.
steps.content: Ancient Roman soldiers wore the stone to battle. In ancient Rome, soldiers often wore tiger’s eye rings and engraved stones before battle for strength and protection. They believed the stone would protect them physically and promote bravery and fearlessness in combat. [38] X Research source
